intro: Platycyamus regnellii var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth platycyamus, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact, herbaceous growth habit and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. The plant has smooth, glabrous leaves that are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a sunny to partially shaded environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
